If you're looking for a superhero movie with a deeper meaning, consider "Man of Steel". The plot explores the odd morality of a film that falls into three distinct parts.

If you're interested in a historical film about religious themes, "The Cross and the Switchblade" is a compelling story about a gang member and a pastor.

If you enjoy fantasy with a touch of reality, "The Last Airbender" is an epic adventure about a young Avatar seeking to stop a powerful enemy.

"Peep World" is a heart-wrenching story about four siblings dealing with the aftermath of a book revealing their lives.

If you're looking for a superhero movie with a similar vibe to "Superman Returns", then "The Wraith" (1986) starring Randy Quaid might be a good choice. It has a similar atmosphere to "Superman" and also features another talented actor in Randy Quaid.

If you're interested in a more grounded superhero film with a focus on psychological and physical challenges, then "The Dark Knight" (2008) starring Christian Bale might be more your style. It's a darker film with complex characters and a captivating story.

If you're interested in a documentary about a daring tightrope walker, then "Man on Wire" (2008) starring Jean-Louis Blondeau would be a compelling watch. It's a visually stunning film that captures the thrill and danger of the high wire act.
